name: Core Features
template:
Based on this project description:

{{description}}

{{#if codebase_context}}
CODEBASE CONTEXT - LEVERAGE THESE EXISTING PATTERNS:
{{codebase_context}}

IMPORTANT: Before proposing new features, check if similar functionality already exists. Prefer extending existing features over creating new ones.
{{/if}}

Generate 5-8 core features for an MVP. For each feature, provide:

{
  "features": [
    {
      "name": "Feature name",
      "what": "What does this feature do?",
      "why": "Why is this important for the MVP?",
      "how": "High-level approach for implementation",
      "testStrategy": "REQUIRED: How will this feature be tested? (e.g., unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests)",
      "acceptanceCriteria": ["List of specific, measurable criteria that define when this feature is complete"],
      "relevantFiles": ["List of exact file paths to create or modify (e.g., 'packages/api/src/handlers/feature.rs')"],
      "similarImplementations": ["References to similar features in the codebase that can be used as patterns"],
      "reuseOpportunities": "Can this leverage existing code? What can be reused vs. built new?",
      "dependsOn": ["List of feature names this depends on"],
      "enables": ["List of features this unlocks"],
      "buildPhase": 1-3 (1=foundation, 2=visible, 3=enhancement),
      "isVisible": true/false (does this give users something to see/use?)
    }
  ]
}

Focus on:
1. Foundation features that must be built first
2. Visible features that users can interact with quickly
3. Enhancement features that build on the foundation
4. EVERY feature MUST have a test strategy - no feature is complete without tests
5. BE SPECIFIC about file paths - provide exact locations, not vague descriptions
6. IDENTIFY reuse opportunities - what existing code can be leveraged?
7. MINIMIZE feature count - can features be combined? Can we start simpler?

Ensure dependencies are logical and create a clear build order.

metadata.description: Generate core features with codebase context, TDD requirements, file specificity, and reuse opportunities (Phase 6B enhancements)
